Name: Requiring clearance signs.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring clearance signs

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: June 13, 2019 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Recessed Meeting of May 29, 2019 Held on June 13, 2019
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 13, 2019

Summary: This bill would mandate clearance signs at least two blocks from an approaching elevated structure.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:	
      Section 1. Subchapter 1 of chapter 1 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding section 19-159.2 to read as follows:
      � 19-159.2. Clearance Signs. The department shall post a sign indicating vehicle overhead clearance requirements at least two blocks away from an overpass, bridge or other elevated structure. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law, except that the department of transportation may take such measures as are necessary for the implementation of this local law, including the promulgation of rules, before such date.
